help_gettingStartedIntro.message: Create a GitHub repository for your bookmarks, then create a Personal Access Token (PAT) with the repo scope. In the GitHub tab, enter token, repository owner, name, branch (usually main), and the folder path (default: bookmarks). Click Test Connection to verify.

help_onboarding.message: If the folder is empty, you can create the base structure (toolbar, other, menu, mobile). If bookmarks already exist in the repo, you can pull them into this browser.

help_profilesIntro.message: Each profile has its own bookmark set and GitHub repo config. Use profiles for work/personal or different devices.

help_profilesAddDesc.message: Select a profile in the dropdown, then Add (new profile), Rename, or Delete. Up to 10 profiles. Deleting removes the selected profile.

help_profilesSwitchDesc.message: Select another profile to switch. Your current bookmarks are saved and pushed to the current profile's repo before switching. The target profile's bookmarks replace the local ones. Use Switch without confirmation to skip the confirm dialog.

help_githubReposDesc.message: Optional: Create a folder with bookmarks to all your GitHub repositories (public and private). Choose the position (toolbar, other, menu). The folder is synced like normal bookmarks; use Update GitHub Repos to refresh the list.

help_popupProfileDesc.message: Switch profiles directly from the popup header.

help_popupSyncNowDesc.message: Full three-way merge sync: local and remote changes are merged automatically when possible.

help_popupPushDesc.message: Upload local bookmarks to GitHub (overwrites remote changes).

help_autoSyncDesc.message: When enabled, syncs automatically when you add, edit, or remove bookmarks. A debounce delay waits for rapid changes to finish before syncing.

help_syncProfilesDesc.message: Real-time (1 min), Frequent (5 min), Normal (15 min), or Power save (60 min). Custom lets you set interval and debounce manually.

help_syncStartupDesc.message: Optional: sync when the browser starts or when you return to the browser window (with cooldown).

help_notificationsDesc.message: Choose when to show sync notifications: All (success and failure), Errors only, or Off.

help_backupBookmarksDesc.message: Export all browser bookmarks as JSON. Import replaces all local bookmarks with the file contents.

help_backupSettingsDesc.message: Export GitHub connection and sync settings (profiles with decrypted tokens). Import replaces all settings; the page reloads afterwards.

help_conflictDesc.message: When both local and remote bookmarks changed, the popup shows a conflict. Choose Push (local wins, overwrite remote) or Pull (remote wins, overwrite local). There is no automatic merge for conflicts.

help_shortcutsNote.message: You can customize shortcuts in the browser's extension settings.

help_whySlowTitle.message: Why does sync sometimes take long?

help_whySlowIntro.message: GitSyncMarks uses GitHub's Git Data API for atomic commits. Each changed or new bookmark file requires an API call. With many changes, this adds up.

help_whyAtomic.message: All changes are written in a single atomic commit: either everything succeeds or nothing does. This prevents partial or corrupted state if the sync is interrupted. One commit instead of many also avoids hitting API rate limits and keeps the Git history clean.

options_exportBookmarksDesc.message: Save your bookmarks as a JSON file.

options_exportSettingsDesc.message: Backup GitHub connection and sync settings.

options_importBookmarksWarning.message: Importing will replace all your current bookmarks. This cannot be undone.

options_importSettingsWarning.message: Importing will replace all current settings. The page will reload afterwards.

options_automationIntro.message: You can add bookmarks directly in your Git repository. The extension will pick them up on the next sync and normalize them automatically.

options_automationFormatDesc.message: Create a JSON file with any name in one of the bookmark folders:

options_automationFolders.message: Available root folders in the repository:

options_automationNormalize.message: On the next sync, the extension will rename the file to its canonical format and add it to the folder's ordering.

options_automationGithubActionDesc.message: A GitHub Action workflow is included to add bookmarks via the GitHub UI or CLI. Copy .github/workflows/add-bookmark.yml to your bookmark repository.

options_automationGithubActionParams.message: folder = root (toolbar/other/menu/mobile); path = optional subfolder. Use base-path if your File Path setting differs from "bookmarks".

options_automationGithubActionWebDesc.message: Go to your repository → Actions → "Add Bookmark" → Run workflow. Fill in the URL, title, and target folder.
